*div1 type="summary"* *p*Ayuntamiento of Brazoria to Congress, July 31, 1834. Memorial in behalf of Austin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*To the *person_mentioned*Supreme Govt of the *location_mentioned*United States of Mexico*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento of the Jurisdiction of *location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* of the *location_mentioned*State of Cuahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned* approaching the Govt, with that high consideration with [which] is due from the subject to the sovereign would most respectfully represent.*/p*
*p*That with feelings of the deepest regret and anxiety they have learned that their *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*and fellow citizen *person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* has been for a long time under arrest and in a state of most rigorous confinement— when *person_mentioned*A*/person_mentioned* was first arrested on his return to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*he requested us to express or feel no anxiety on his account. For relying on the purity of his intentions his established character and his known devoted adherence to the constitution and laws of his *location_mentioned*adopted country*/location_mentioned* he could not anticipate that his detention would be more than temporary. From that time until very recently we have been totaly ignorant of his true situation. Hence we have been perfectly silent lest in attempting to do good we might possibly do an injury.*/p*
*p*But now when our information is such as can be confidently relied on we concieve it to be a duty we owe to ourselves to *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*and to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to make a full frank and candid statement of facts with a view to the removal of impressions unfavorable to the character of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and injurious to *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned*. The situation of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*before the meeting of the convention which adopted the constitution of which *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*was the *person_mentioned*bearer */person_mentioned*was distressing beyond description The *person_mentioned*Congress of the State*/person_mentioned* was either ignorant of oar wants or unable or unwilling to apply the necessary remedy The administration of justice was a mere mockery the rights of the *person_mentioned*citizens */person_mentioned*were trampled on with impunity. The person, property, or liberty of the *person_mentioned*subject */person_mentioned*unprotected, the *person_mentioned*innocent */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*unofending */person_mentioned*were frequently the *person_mentioned*victims */person_mentioned*of persecution while the *person_mentioned*lawless */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*guilty*/person_mentioned* often passed unpunished. Living at a distance of *location_mentioned*near 700 miles from the capital of the state*/location_mentioned* having but two *person_mentioned*members */person_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* in *person_mentioned*Congress*/person_mentioned*, having feelings views, habits and pursuits entirely different and distinct from the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* the voice of our complaints and petition was either unheard or disregarded.*/p*
*p*In this state of things it was conceived that unless some remedy could be applied disorganization and ruin would be the inevitable consequences these were the reasons which produced a call of that convention these were the reasons which prompted that convention to form a plan of constitution and these were the reasons which induced *person_mentioned*Austin */person_mentioned*at an immense sacrifice to undertake the discharge of the duties imposed on him with a confident hope that he would be able to render effective services to his *person_mentioned*countrymen*/person_mentioned*. That he has been unsuccessful in his mission is but too true and the consequences to have been of the most unfortunate character*/p*
*p*We know not the charges upon which *person_mentioned*A */person_mentioned*has been arrested and hence it is impossible to refute them. But if it be true as has been alleged by some that he is suspected of having designs upon the integrity of the *location_mentioned*Mexican Territory*/location_mentioned* we reply that the allegation is a libel as well upon the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* as upon *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned*. These *person_mentioned*people*/person_mentioned* have never for one single moment entertained such a monstrious idea and *person_mentioned*A */person_mentioned*is the last man against whom such a charge could be successfully made. His motto has universally been the constituition Laws federal and state and one some occasions he has even aroused the feelings of some of his *person_mentioned*countrymen */person_mentioned*against him by advising a tame and humiliating submission to the indignities which have been heaped upon us. These are facts too notorious to be question and to doubt them would be evidence of the weakest incredulity. Since *person_mentioned*A */person_mentioned*was dispatched to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*the most favourable changes have taken place in the political affairs of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*National Congress*/person_mentioned* in answer to our petitions has repealed the obnoxious feature of the Law at the*date_mentioned n="04-06-1830"> 6th of Apl 1830*/date_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*Govt, of our state */person_mentioned*having come to a knowledge of our wants and prompted by a spirit of justice and liberality with which its later acts have been characterised has extended its arm of relief and applied the necessary remedy to our wrongs.*/p*
*p*The administration of the laws is placed upon a firm and intelligible basis the trial by *person_mentioned*Jury */person_mentioned*the bulwark of our liberty is established and the property and life and liberty of the subject is secured for all of which distinguished marks of kindness and liberality we take this public opportunity of tendering our most cordial and heartfelt gratitude both to the *person_mentioned*Federal and State Govts*/person_mentioned*. In conclusion we most humbly pray that our friend and fellow citizen*person_mentioned* S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* may be immediately discharged and that he be permitted without further molestation to return to his *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*and to his *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned* assuring the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, that should an opportunity ever present itself *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* will prove that it is ready and willing to spend its blood and treasure in support of the *person_mentioned*Mexican */person_mentioned*Constitution, the *person_mentioned*Mexican */person_mentioned*Laws and the *location_mentioned*Mexican Territory*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*God and Liberty*/p* *p**date_mentioned n="07-31-1834">July [31?] 1834*/date_mentioned* */p* *p**person_mentioned*Edwin Waller*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Alcalde*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm, H. Wharton,*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*1st. Regidor*/person_mentioned**/p*
